critique: This executive order focuses on improving coordination and collaboration between federal agencies and state/local governments regarding grantmaking activities. It establishes Federal Regional Councils and an Under Secretaries Group for Regional Operations to streamline program delivery, resolve conflicts, and develop interagency strategies. There is no mention of immigration. It seems to centralize power at the federal level to improve coordination. It does not seem to touch on civil liberties or national security. It seems to promote government intervention to improve efficiency. It does not seem to touch on social inclusion. It does not expand executive power.
